content:
Yes, there has been opposition and resistance to the new government in Tunisia. 

One example is the ongoing protests and demonstrations against the government's economic policies, particularly the high unemployment rate and inflation. These protests started in early 2021 and have resulted in clashes with police and arrests of protesters.

In addition, some opposition parties have criticized the government's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and its response to recent security incidents, such as terrorist attacks in the capital city of Tunis. 

There have also been reports of tensions between the various political parties in the governing coalition, with some accusing others of being too dominant and ignoring minority voices.
